reuze

Class mf_InferenceProcedureBCAsk

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuze.mf_InferenceProcedureBCAsk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    mf_i_InferenceProcedure

    public class mf_InferenceProcedureBCAsk
extends java.lang.Object
implements mf_i_InferenceProcedure
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (2nd Edition): Figure 9.6, page 288.

     function FOL-BC-ASK(KB, goals, theta) returns a set of substitutions
   input: KB, a knowledge base
          goals, a list of conjuncts forming a query (theta already applied)
          theta, the current substitution, initially the empty substitution {}
   local variables: answers, a set of substitutions, initially empty
   
   if goals is empty then return {theta}
   qDelta <- SUBST(theta, FIRST(goals))
   for each sentence r in KB where STANDARDIZE-APART(r) = (p1 ˆ ... ˆ pn => q)
          and thetaDelta <- UNIFY(q, qDelta) succeeds
       new_goals <- [p1,...,pn|REST(goals)]
       answers <- FOL-BC-ASK(KB, new_goals, COMPOSE(thetaDelta, theta)) U answers
   return answers
    Figure 9.6 A simple backward-chaining algorithm.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Mike Stampone
